name: quarto-wizard
description: A Visual Studio Code extension that helps you manage Quarto projects.

scripts.vscode:prepublish: npm run format && npm run build:core && npx webpack --mode production
scripts.webpack: npm run format && npm run build:core && npx webpack --mode development --stats-error-details
scripts.watch: npm run format && npm run build:core && npx webpack --watch --mode development --stats-error-details
scripts.test-compile: npm run format && npm run build:core && npx tsc -p ./
scripts.pretest: npm run test-compile && npm run lint
scripts.docs:api: typedoc --options typedoc.config.mjs && node scripts/process-api-docs.mjs && npm run docs:format
scripts.docs:build: npm run docs:api && cd docs && quarto render
scripts.docs:preview: npm run docs:api && cd docs && quarto preview

commands.title: Install Extensions
commands.description: Opens the extension browser to browse and install Quarto extensions from the registry.

commands.title: Use Template
commands.description: Opens the template browser to select and install Quarto templates.

commands.title: Show Quarto Wizard Log Output
commands.description: Displays the extension's output log for debugging and troubleshooting.

commands.title: Clear Recently Installed Extensions
commands.description: Clears the list of recently installed extensions and templates.

commands.title: Clear Extension Cache
commands.description: Clears the cached registry data to force a fresh download.

commands.title: Quarto Reproducible Document
commands.description: Creates a new reproducible example document for R, Python, or Julia.

commands.title: Get Extensions Details
commands.description: Retrieves detailed information about extensions in the current workspace.

commands.title: Refresh Installed Extensions
commands.description: Reload the list of installed extensions in the Explorer View.

commands.title: Open Extension Source
commands.description: Open the extension's GitHub repository in a browser.

commands.title: Update Extension
commands.description: Update a specific extension to its latest version.

commands.title: Remove Extension
commands.description: Remove a specific extension from the workspace.

commands.title: Reveal in Explorer View
commands.description: Open the extension's folder in the file explorer.

commands.title: Update All Extensions
commands.description: Update all outdated extensions in the workspace.

commands.title: Remove Multiple Extensions
commands.description: Select and remove multiple extensions at once.

commands.title: Set GitHub Token (Manual)
commands.description: Manually set a GitHub personal access token for authentication.

commands.title: Clear GitHub Token (Manual)
commands.description: Remove the manually set GitHub token.

commands.title: Install Extension from Registry
commands.description: Install an extension by entering its registry identifier.

commands.title: Install Extension from URL
commands.description: Install an extension from a direct URL to a .zip or .tar.gz archive.

commands.title: Install Extension from Local
commands.description: Install extension(s) from a local directory or archive file.

viewsWelcome.contents:
No Quarto extensions installed ([browse extensions](https://m.canouil.dev/quarto-extensions/)).
[Install Extensions](command:quartoWizard.installExtension)
To learn more about Quarto and Quarto extensions [read the documentation](https://quarto.org/).

quartoWizard.ask.trustAuthors.markdownDescription: Ask for confirmation before trusting an extension author. `ask` to ask for confirmation, `never` to always confirm and never ask again.
quartoWizard.ask.trustAuthors.title: Trust Authors

quartoWizard.ask.confirmInstall.markdownDescription: Ask for confirmation before installing an extension. `ask` to ask for confirmation, `never` to always confirm and never ask again.
quartoWizard.ask.confirmInstall.title: Confirm Installation

quartoWizard.log.level.markdownDescription: The level of logging to use. `error` to only log errors, `warn` to log warnings and errors, `info` to log info, warnings, and errors, `debug` to log everything.
quartoWizard.log.level.title: Log Level

quartoWizard.cache.ttlMinutes.markdownDescription: Cache duration for extension registry data in minutes. Lower values fetch fresher data but increase network requests. Default is 30 minutes.
quartoWizard.cache.ttlMinutes.title: Cache Duration

quartoWizard.registry.url.markdownDescription: URL to the Quarto extensions registry JSON file. Change this to use a custom registry. The registry must contain entries with at least `id`, `name`, and `owner` fields.
quartoWizard.registry.url.title: Registry URL
